intro: Valerianella aralocaspia, commonly known as the Caspian valerian, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found near water bodies. It has a short lifespan and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates. Its medicinal properties have been explored for their potential calming effects.
